thread.title: Gambling commission launches investigation into Sutton goalkeeper Wayne Shaw's pie-eating stunt
thread.title_full: Gambling commission launches investigation into Sutton goalkeeper Wayne Shaw's pie-eating stunt

author: James Benge
title: Gambling commission launches investigation into Sutton goalkeeper Wayne Shaw's pie-eating stunt
text:
Tuesday 21 February 2017 12:52 GMT Click to followES Sport Stunt: Wayne Shaw has claimed the snack was not a pie on his Twitter feed BBC 
The Gambling Commission has opened an investigation in Sutton United goalkeeper Wayne Shaw’s pie-eating on the bench in Monday night’s FA Cup defeat to Arsenal . 
Reserve goalkeeper Shaw was pictured tucking into a pasty after Sutton manager Paul Doswell had made his three substitutions in the 2-0 loss at Gander Green Lane. 
Shaw, 46, has since admitted he was aware of an offer by bookmakers Sun Bets, Sutton’s match sponsor for the game, of 8-1 odds that the goalkeeper would be seen eating during the game. 
The prank has seemingly brought Shaw the wrong type of attention, with the government’s regulatory body for gambling confirming it will undertake an investigation. Sutton goalkeeper's pie-eating stunt earns him the wrath of boss 
Richard Watson, commission enforcement and intelligence director, said: “Integrity in sport is not a joke and we have opened an investigation to establish exactly what happened. 
“As part of that we’ll be looking into any irregularity in the betting market and establishing whether the operator has met its licence requirement to conduct its business with integrity.” 
The commission had previously warned bookmakers over “issues of integrity” linked to novelty betting markets. 
Shaw, 23-stone, said: “A few of the lads said to me earlier on what is going on with the 8-1 about eating a pie. Sutton United's Wayne Shaw on Good Morning Britain 
“I said I don't know I have eaten nothing all day. So I might give it a go later on. 
“As I say what is that, they had us at 8-1 to eat a pie. I thought I would give them a bit of banter and let's do it. All the subs were on and we were 2-0 down. 
“I went and got it at half time from the kitchen, I had it all prepared and ready to go. It was meat and potato.” In Pictures | Sutton United vs Arsenal | 20/02/2017 In Pictures | Sutton United vs Arsenal | 20/02/2017 1/50
